description: From Latin ōre rotundō (“with a round mouth”) hence “clear, loud”, from ōs (“mouth”) + rotundus (“round”).

adjectives.description: orotund (comparative more orotund, superlative most orotund)

entries.meaning: Characterized by fullness, clarity, strength, and smoothness of sound.

examples: In orotund turns of phrase—indeed, in spiraling helices of phrase; in snarled fishing lines of phrase; in endless small intestines of phrase--the speakers ingeniously explored and invented connections between qwerty, alphabetical filing, and socioeconomic advance.
